name: updateClient
description: Update information about an OAuth Client on your Account. This can be especially useful to update the `redirect_uri` of your client in the event that the callback url changed in your application.

clientId.description: The OAuth Client ID to look up.

$block: A third-party application registered to Linode that users may log into with their Linode account through our authentication server at https://login.linode.com. Using an OAuth Client, a third-party developer may be given access to some, or all, of a User's account for the purposes of their application.

$ul: **id**: The OAuth Client ID.  This is used to identify the client, and is a publicly-known value (it is not a secret).
**label**: The name of this application.  This will be presented to users when they are asked to grant it access to their Account.
**public**: If this is a public or private OAuth Client. Public clients have a slightly different authentication workflow than private clients. See the OAuth spec for more details. (default: false)

**redirect_uri**: The location a successful log in from https://login.linode.com should be redirected to for this client. The receiver of this redirect should be ready to accept an OAuth exchange code and finish the OAuth exchange.

**secret**: The OAuth Client secret, used in the OAuth exchange.  This is returned as `<REDACTED>` except when an OAuth Client is created or its secret is reset.  This is a secret, and should not be shared or disclosed publicly.
**status**: The status of this application.  `active` by default.
**thumbnail_url**: The URL where this client's thumbnail may be viewed, or `null` if this client does not have a thumbnail set.
